meanings.definition: The state of being viable or capable of living or developing.
meanings.sent1: The viabilities of the seeds were evident as they sprouted and grew into healthy plants.
meanings.sent2: She doubted the viabilities of the plan due to its lack of resources.
meanings.sent3: The viabilities of the new business idea were put to the test when they ran out of funding.
meanings.sent4: His viabilities as a leader shone through during the crisis, guiding the team to safety.
meanings.sent5: The viabilities of the project depended on the cooperation of all team members.

meanings.definition: The ability to work successfully or be effective.
meanings.sent1: The viabilities of the new strategy were proven when sales increased.
meanings.sent2: Teamwork is essential for the viabilities of the project.
meanings.sent3: The viabilities of the vacuum cleaner were put to the test with the messy room.
meanings.sent4: Her viabilities as a problem solver were unmatched in the company.
meanings.sent5: The viabilities of the medicine were evident in the quick recovery of the patient.

meanings.definition: The ability to be done or to succeed.
meanings.sent1: The viabilities of the plan were questioned due to the lack of support.
meanings.sent2: The viabilities of the mission seemed slim, but they were determined to succeed.
meanings.sent3: The viabilities of the cake baking contest were put to the test with her burnt dessert.
meanings.sent4: His viabilities as a chef were evident in the delicious meal he prepared.
meanings.sent5: The viabilities of the project hinged on securing the necessary funding.
